name: DockerCompose
description: Define and run multi-container applications with Docker Compose
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: dockerHostEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Host Connetion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the connection to the Docker container host.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the connection to the Docker Registry.

inputs.name: dockerComposeFile
inputs.label: Docker Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to docker-compose file to use with the Docker Compose. Wild cards can be used. For example ' \*\*/docker-compose.yml' or '\*\*/docker-compose.yaml'.

inputs.name: dockerComposeFileArgs
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Arguments that need to be passed to Docker compose file. These will be set as environment variables. Specify each argument as name=value pair in a new line, for example,
HTTP_PROXY=fabrikamweb.mydomain.com
HTTP_PORT=80

inputs.name: dockerComposeCommand
inputs.label: Docker Compose Command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Docker Compose command along with its arguments. for example, Using 'up -d' starts the containers in the background and leaves them running, other examples are 'down --rmi all -v' or 'restart'.
Note: Recommended to use detached mode (-d) to avoid blocking the agent.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the certificates will be created.
